definition: meals (abbr. for 伙食[huo3 shi2])/variant of 夥|伙[huo3]
companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together

sentences.english: He abetted the thief in robbing the bank.
sentences.chinese: 他伙同那个窃贼抢劫银行。

sentences.english: The scab union bureaucrats lined up with the bosses against the workers.
sentences.chinese: 那些黄色工人的官僚们伙同老板一起对付工人。

sentences.english: Authorities say the former football star was in a group of people that stole sports memorabilia.
sentences.chinese: 官方称这名前球星伙同他人偷走了体育纪念品。

sentences.english: She ganged up on me with those rough boys.
sentences.chinese: 她伙同那些粗野的男孩对付我。

sentences.english: Whoever conspires with the persons listed in the preceding two paragraphs to engage in embezzlement shall be punished as an accomplice in the crime.
sentences.chinese: 与前两款所列人员勾结，伙同贪污的，以共犯论处。

sentences.english: Hwang Korean prosecutors are afraid of retaliation, along with South Korea to continue to deceive the Emperor Hwang.
sentences.chinese: 检查官害怕韩滉报复，伙同韩滉继续欺骗皇帝。

definition: to make a full confession/to plead guilty
to incite/to prompt (sb to do sth)
(of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
